Coronavirus (COVID19) Information
Twin River Public Schools remains dedicated to the health and safety of students and staff, and will continue to respond to health concerns in a reasonable, responsible manner.
For information from the CDC, go toÂ https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

div.p: Twin River Public Schools remains dedicated to the health and safety of students and staff, and will continue to respond to health concerns in a reasonable, responsible manner.
For information from the CDC, go toÂ https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

There are a number of great resources - all free - that you can take advantage of to help your child continue their education despite school being closed.
News Channel Nebraska features morning program presented by teachers for your child.Â When you get the News Channel Nebraska website, you will see a blue bar at the top of the page that says "Watch NCN on this device click here".Â Click on that and you will be able to watch.Â It is also available on your NCN cable channel.
https://plattevalley.newschannelnebraska.com/Â
An outstanding resource is the list, linked below, of all sorts of important medical links and information, and below it, all sorts of educational information, online libraries, movies and much more.Â Please share these links so everyone knows about them!
https://www.reddit.com/r/CoronavirusUS/comments/flejon/an_updating_list_of_free_services_and_things_to/?utm_content=body&utm_medium=post_embed&utm_name=7f628e99a46f4e45a4ecebe7fcc39bd7&utm_source=embedly&utm_term=flejonÂ Â Â Â
div.h3: Nebraska Department of Education Information on Schools

a.title: E-mail this article to a friend.

div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 11:56 am CDT

td.span: A slight chance of sprinkles. Partly sunny, with a high near 64. Breezy, with a north northwest wind around 25 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 39. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 15 to 20 mph decreasing to 5 to 10 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 76. West northwest wind 5 to 10 mph becoming south in the afternoon.

p.strong: If you have any questions, please contact mreardon@esu7.org

input.p: Your name, phone number and email address are kept private and are for the sole use of the Twin River Schools site. For full details, see our privacy and security policy.
